title.narrative: Emergency WASH and Cash assistance to IDPs affected by crisis in Maban and Renk Counties South Sudan

description.narrative:
The current crisis in South Sudan, which has been ongoing since 14 December 2013, has resulted in huge population displacements (IDPs). As of January 23rd, approximately 575,500 are reported as displaced as a result of armed conflict.
Many thousands more, as yet unrecorded are likely to have fled their homes. Over 74,000 of these have already fled into neighboring countries, whilst the death toll is now estimated at over 10,000 people. The humanitarian situation in many areas is extremely grave. Many families are being housed at UN bases across South Sudan, with others seeking shelter in Church Premises/nearby bushes or with host families.
UNOCHA situation report # 13 , claims that over 100,000 people are reportedly displaced in Upper Nile State. Some of those displaced have sought refuge in nearby counties such as this projects target regions of Renk and Maban. The displaced have walked long distances without any food, assets or form of shelter and staying in the open (often under trees).
Currently the most urgent needs experienced in target counties are; shelter, NFI’s, WASH, food and health. The areas the displaced are seeking protection in (Renk and Maban) are not able to absorb all their needs.
This proposed three month rapid response aims to provide urgent humanitarian assistance through emergency unconditional cash transfer, latrine construction and hygiene promotion to IDPs affected by armed conflict in South Sudan. The project will reach 1,600 individual IDPs (320 HH) with urgently needed cash transfer and WASH assistance in Maban, and 1,250 individual IDPs (250 HH) in Renk with unconditional cash transfer.
Proposed activities include: Construction of 32 emergency latrines. Hygiene promotion in Maban for 1,600 IDPS. Unconditional cash transfer for 1,600 (in both Renk and Maban for food supplies and NFIs).
